p:
Chemically, CQ is made up of 7-chloro-4 (-4-dimethylamino-1-methyl butyl amino) quinoline. The CQ/HCQ belongs to the same family of weak bases, alkylated 4-aminoquinolines.
5 HCQ differs due to the presence of a hydroxyl group in its side chain with N-ethyl substitute being beta-hydroxylated. Both can easily cross cell membranes, with HCQ being more polar with a lower lipophilic effect.
